paper_abstract: We determine an asymptotic formula for the number of labelled 2-connected (simple) graphs on n vertices and m edges, provided that m - n and m = O(nlog n) as n . This is the entire range of m not covered by previous results. The proof involves determining properties of the core and kernel of random graphs with minimum degree at least 2. The case of 2-edge-connectedness is treated similarly. We also obtain formulae for the number of 2-connected graphs with given degree sequence for most (typical) sequences. Our main result solves a problem of Wright from 1983. (c) 2012 Wiley Periodicals, Inc.
